Hi, Cecilia.
 
Catalina didn’t provide me with the quote in a nice pdf format – only by email. Please see attached. 
 
And apologies, my email was not written in the best way. What I meant was what the turnaround time would be to (1) have the deck translated into Spanish and Portuguese (full translation of slides – not notes – as I outlined below) and (2) if we only did the review/QA of their translations.
 
Hopefully it’s clearer now. Thank you!

Here is my estimate according to what you provided and all the files, I have divided it by files:
 
Understanding Your Cultural Lens_FINAL
Linguistic QA: 7 hs
Post DTP QA: 2 hs
LATAM_LeadingInclusively-Solo_2024_FINALv2
Linguistic QA: 12 hs
Post DTP QA: 3 hs
 
TOTAL QA TIME
: 24 hs / Language
TOTAL USD:
 
1800 USD per language
.
 
 
Linguistic QA: Implies editing translations
Post DTP QA: involves making sure layout after translation and DTP mirrors exactly as source.
Both tasks include the revision of everything translated and formatted by client, this includes subtitles of videos. Notes were not included in the estimate.
These costs also include the implementation of edits in PPT but NOT in videos. If subtitles need to be modified, those costs will be analyzed separately.
 
Please let me know if this is clear or if the estimate should be provided in any different way.
 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

 RE: how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hello Rebecca,
 
For some reason I cannot access the PPT files provided below.
 
Just some things while you re share with me the files:
 
We will just QA and we will not translate anything or be in charge of creating subtitles. (I mention this because it can be confusing what they will do and what we will do)  
We will just QA and not translate anything. Let’s assume we’re not creating subtitles.
The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom. 
Yes.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)  
Yes
Can you confirm this is correct? And reshare the files with me?
 
The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.
 
Thank you!!
Cecilia

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 
(which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)

Asunto:
 Cardinal Health- SBC Minor Update
 
Hi Nicole and Cecila,
 
Our customer Cardinal Health has come back this year and would like to make a minor update to their Standard of Business Course. They would simply like to update the course from "2023" to "2025."
 
LCW worked on their SBC, and the files are available in SFS as well: 
https://securefiles.diligentboards.com/web/drive/diid:ce5621fa-badb-4ef2-9024-387575ba6cec
 
This update would apply for all languages. May I please request a quote from your team and the ETA for this work once approved?
 
 
Thank you,
Karen

subject: Re: CARDINAL HEALTH
body:
Those files are not the same. One is the file used to create the module and it has all the ingredients and assets within that file. The other is a published zip package that can be uploaded to an LMS to take, but not customize. 
Best,
Dustin
On Fri, Apr 4, 2025, 11:48 AM Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hello Dustin,
 
This is what client has just sent us:
 
Regarding the two options you presented- the customer is hoping to just remove the year "2023" from all the material, for all languages. So, whichever option covers this work would be what we need.
 
Please also confirm if source files 
are not the same
 as unlocked SCORM files.
 
Please let me know what you think the best approach is and if the source files are not the same so I can share tht with client. Ill let you know of course if approval to proceed is received.
Cecilia

Translation Specialist
LCW

Asunto:
 Re: CARDINAL HEALTH
 
Hey Cecilia,
 
If the quote is for organizing their files and uploading them it would just be 2hrs.
 
If they want us to update the title, publish, test and send it would be 6hrs on my end. Either option would just be a 2 day turnaround on my end once approved.
 
The source file gives any of their clients the ability to have the file and the entire design to do what they want with. That would be up to Diligent if it works with their pay model and if it doesn't put them 
at risk of the client then being able to update on their own moving forward.
 
Let me know if you need any other language for the client.
 
Best,
Dustin
 
Best,
Dustin

> wrote:
Hello Dustin,
 
I hope you are doing great today!
 
We need you to provide a quote and TAT for the following:
 
Cardinal Health would like to make a minor update to their Standard of Business Course. They would simply like to update the course from "2023" to "2025."
 
LCW worked on their SBC, and the files are available in SFS as well: 
https://securefiles.diligentboards.com/web/drive/diid:ce5621fa-badb-4ef2-9024-387575ba6cec
 
This update would apply for all languages. 
 
They also sent us the following question that I hope you can help us to reply:
Last year, the customer had requested the unlocked SCORMs for their Standards of Business Course so they could adjust the "2023" to "2025" themselves. We had provided them with the unlocked SCORMS, but they provided the following commentary recently: "We did not receive the source files. We received the unlocked published SCORM files. We were able to modify the XML code to remove the year, but when we updated the course for this year the code reverted. For us to make an update that would 100% fix this issue, we need the source file and not the unlocked published SCORM file."
 
Is someone from your team able to explain the difference between source files in this instance and unlocked SCORMs? Or confirm that the customer should be able to make adjustments to the year on their own? Their team also uses Articulate360.
 
 
I appreciate your input here!
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

subject: RE: Boston Scientific: Turnaround times + quote documents

Catalina didn’t provide me with the quote in a nice pdf format – only by email. Please see attached. 
 
And apologies, my email was not written in the best way. What I meant was what the turnaround time would be to (1) have the deck translated into Spanish and Portuguese (full translation of slides – not notes – as I outlined below) and (2) if we only did the review/QA of their translations.
 
Hopefully it’s clearer now. Thank you!

Yes.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)  
Yes

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 
(which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)

CC:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Asunto:
 Re: CARDINAL HEALTH
 
Hey Cecilia,
 
If the quote is for organizing their files and uploading them it would just be 2hrs.
 
If they want us to update the title, publish, test and send it would be 6hrs on my end. Either option would just be a 2 day turnaround on my end once approved.
 
The source file gives any of their clients the ability to have the file and the entire design to do what they want with. That would be up to Diligent if it works with their pay model and if it doesn't put them 
at risk of the client then being able to update on their own moving forward.
 
Let me know if you need any other language for the client.
 
Best,
Dustin
 
Best,
Dustin
 
On Thu, Apr 3, 2025, 1:00 PM Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hello Dustin,
 
I hope you are doing great today!
 
We need you to provide a quote and TAT for the following:
 
Cardinal Health would like to make a minor update to their Standard of Business Course. They would simply like to update the course from "2023" to "2025."
 
LCW worked on their SBC, and the files are available in SFS as well: 
https://securefiles.diligentboards.com/web/drive/diid:ce5621fa-badb-4ef2-9024-387575ba6cec
 
This update would apply for all languages. 
 
They also sent us the following question that I hope you can help us to reply:
Last year, the customer had requested the unlocked SCORMs for their Standards of Business Course so they could adjust the "2023" to "2025" themselves. We had provided them with the unlocked SCORMS, but they provided the following commentary recently: "We did not receive the source files. We received the unlocked published SCORM files. We were able to modify the XML code to remove the year, but when we updated the course for this year the code reverted. For us to make an update that would 100% fix this issue, we need the source file and not the unlocked published SCORM file."
 
Is someone from your team able to explain the difference between source files in this instance and unlocked SCORMs? Or confirm that the customer should be able to make adjustments to the year on their own? Their team also uses Articulate360.
 
 
I appreciate your input here!
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

TOTAL QA TIME
: 24 hs / Language

1800 USD per language
.
 
 
Linguistic QA: Implies editing translations
Post DTP QA: involves making sure layout after translation and DTP mirrors exactly as source.

These costs also include the implementation of edits in PPT but NOT in videos. If subtitles need to be modified, those costs will be analyzed separately.
 
Please let me know if this is clear or if the estimate should be provided in any different way.

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 
(which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 
(which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla

c.mariotta@lcwmail.com

Hello Dustin,
 
I hope you are doing great today!
 
We need you to provide a quote and TAT for the following:
 
Cardinal Health would like to make a minor update to their Standard of Business Course. They would simply like to update the course from "2023" to "2025."
 
LCW worked on their SBC, and the files are available in SFS as well: 
https://securefiles.diligentboards.com/web/drive/diid:ce5621fa-badb-4ef2-9024-387575ba6cec
 
This update would apply for all languages. 
 
They also sent us the following question that I hope you can help us to reply:
Last year, the customer had requested the unlocked SCORMs for their Standards of Business Course so they could adjust the "2023" to "2025" themselves. We had provided them with the unlocked SCORMS, but they provided the following commentary recently: "We did not receive the source files. We received the unlocked published SCORM files. We were able to modify the XML code to remove the year, but when we updated the course for this year the code reverted. For us to make an update that would 100% fix this issue, we need the source file and not the unlocked published SCORM file."
 
Is someone from your team able to explain the difference between source files in this instance and unlocked SCORMs? Or confirm that the customer should be able to make adjustments to the year on their own? Their team also uses Articulate360.
 
 
I appreciate your input here!
Cecilia

subject: REVISED: Upcoming Online Availability Changes
body:
Hi team,
I wanted to say thank you first for the support and well wishes I have received regarding my husband's health. We have been going through it but there is light at the end of the tunnel.
Just wanted to communicate to everyone that my hours of availability starting Monday will be 8am EST -12pm EST everyday including Tuesdays and Fridays (previously Tuesdays and Fridays were 8-11am EST). As a reminder of any meetings that happen outside of that time frame, I will do my best  to adjust my time online to accommodate that meeting since my hours are limited.
For example, if there's an hour meeting at 3pm EST then my hours would be 8am EST-11am EST or 9am EST -12pm EST and I will log back in to attend the meeting at 3pm EST. 
Any one-on-one meetings will be ad hoc. 
 
As always if you need to reach me regarding an urgent need that cannot wait or be delegated you can reach me on WhatsApp: 703-504-8519
And text at 6572240067.
 
If you need me to be available online at later times on a particular day, please reach out to me and I will work with you. 
Thanks!
Juri Mansour (She/Her)
Consultant Project Associate
LCW
From:
 Juri Mansour
Sent:
 Friday, January 24, 2025 4:05 AM
To:
 Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>; Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>; Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>; Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Catalina De Sanctis <c.desanctis@lcwmail.com>; Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Upcoming Online Availability Changes
 
 
Hello team,
Today going forward I will be limited in being online on Tuesdays and Fridays with hours being 8-11 am EST. The rest of the days I'll be online from 8am-12pm EST.  Tuesday's schedule is temporary just for the next month. I will let you know if that changes.
I will be flexible on days that client meetings must happen outside of these hours and adjust those days online availability to accommodate those meetings. 
Any one-on-one meetings will be ad hoc. 
As always if you need to reach me regarding an urgent need that cannot wait or be delegated you can reach me on WhatsApp: 703-504-8519
And text at 6572240067.
If you need me to be available online at later times in a day, please reach out to me and I will work with you. 
I am still sick with my respiratory system being mainly affected. I have never been this sick so I would appreciate your patience with me. I am functional though my ability to speak will be limited until I recover more hopefully sooner rather than later. I will reserve my speaking for client meetings and on rest of meetings I will reply in chat unless absolutely necessary to speak.
Thank you for your understanding & patience. And again please reach out to me if you would like to work with me on adjusting my availability for particular days even if it's just one offs.
Juri
Get 
Outlook for iOS

body:

Thanks!

subject: Re: CARDINAL HEALTH
body:
Hey Cecilia,
If the quote is for organizing their files and uploading them it would just be 2hrs.
If they want us to update the title, publish, test and send it would be 6hrs on my end. Either option would just be a 2 day turnaround on my end once approved.
The source file gives any of their clients the ability to have the file and the entire design to do what they want with. That would be up to Diligent if it works with their pay model and if it doesn't put them at risk of the client then being able to update on their own moving forward.
Let me know if you need any other language for the client.
Best,
Dustin
Best,
Dustin
On Thu, Apr 3, 2025, 1:00 PM Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hello Dustin,
 
I hope you are doing great today!
 
We need you to provide a quote and TAT for the following:
 
Cardinal Health would like to make a minor update to their Standard of Business Course. They would simply like to update the course from "2023" to "2025."
 
LCW worked on their SBC, and the files are available in SFS as well: 
https://securefiles.diligentboards.com/web/drive/diid:ce5621fa-badb-4ef2-9024-387575ba6cec
 
This update would apply for all languages. 
 
They also sent us the following question that I hope you can help us to reply:
Last year, the customer had requested the unlocked SCORMs for their Standards of Business Course so they could adjust the "2023" to "2025" themselves. We had provided them with the unlocked SCORMS, but they provided the following commentary recently: "We did not receive the source files. We received the unlocked published SCORM files. We were able to modify the XML code to remove the year, but when we updated the course for this year the code reverted. For us to make an update that would 100% fix this issue, we need the source file and not the unlocked published SCORM file."
 
Is someone from your team able to explain the difference between source files in this instance and unlocked SCORMs? Or confirm that the customer should be able to make adjustments to the year on their own? Their team also uses Articulate360.
 
 
I appreciate your input here!
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 
(which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!

subject: CARDINAL HEALTH
body:
Hello Dustin,
 
I hope you are doing great today!
 
We need you to provide a quote and TAT for the following:
 
Cardinal Health would like to make a minor update to their Standard of Business Course. They would simply like to update the course from "2023" to "2025."
 
LCW worked on their SBC, and the files are available in SFS as well: 
https://securefiles.diligentboards.com/web/drive/diid:ce5621fa-badb-4ef2-9024-387575ba6cec
 
This update would apply for all languages. 
 
They also sent us the following question that I hope you can help us to reply:
Last year, the customer had requested the unlocked SCORMs for their Standards of Business Course so they could adjust the "2023" to "2025" themselves. We had provided them with the unlocked SCORMS, but they provided the following commentary recently: "We did not receive the source files. We received the unlocked published SCORM files. We were able to modify the XML code to remove the year, but when we updated the course for this year the code reverted. For us to make an update that would 100% fix this issue, we need the source file and not the unlocked published SCORM file."
 
Is someone from your team able to explain the difference between source files in this instance and unlocked SCORMs? Or confirm that the customer should be able to make adjustments to the year on their own? Their team also uses Articulate360.
 
 
I appreciate your input here!
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

Asunto:
 Unlocked SCORMs Inquiry
 
Hello Again Nicole and Cecila,
 
I had a quick question for Cardinal Health (separate from the quote requested). Last year, the customer had requested the unlocked SCORMs for their Standards of Business Course so they could adjust the "2023" to "2025" themselves. We had provided them with the unlocked SCORMS, but they provided the following commentary recently: 
"
We did not receive the source files. We received the unlocked published SCORM files. We were able to modify the XML code to remove the year, but when we updated the course for this year the code reverted. For us to make an update that would 100% fix this issue, we need the source file and not the unlocked published SCORM file."
 
Is someone from your team able to explain the difference between source files in this instance and unlocked SCORMs? Or confirm that the customer should be able to make adjustments to the year on their own? Their team also uses Articulate360.
 
 
Thank you,
Karen

Asunto:
 Fw: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Hi. No rush, but I need your help with the onboarding of new translators.
 
Can you look at the attached "Translator-Interpreter Profile" doc & lmk if you would need to send this to new translators you hire? It looks like a way to capture their bank info (which SG could get off their invoice or other ways). And, it looks like it helps you track their rates. Let me know if you think you need to use this doc and/or make any changes to it.
 
I've also attached an email template I'm putting together that you could s
end to new translators to get what you need in terms of paperwork. I added a bunch of things in red I'm still working on. What else would you want to include in this doc? Do you need to share info about Trados here or anything else? Feel free to edit the doc.
 
I've also attached the updated Translator Agreement I am working on. Sending more of an FYI.
 
I know this is a lot. It's not a rush as I said. I'm just trying to help get you everything you need to send to new translators.
 
Happy to talk on thee phone about this another time too if easier.
 
Thanks!
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 6:01 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
So the way we currently pay vendors, in order of preference, is:
 
ACH to a US bank account
PayPal
(international wire, but the service we use is currently unavailable due to their vendor issues – I am looking into other options)
 
We don’t send physical checks anymore, it’s electronic only. For US bank accounts, I need the vendor to provide an email address, and then I will send them an invite to create a QuickBooks Money account to manage their information (or send me routing & account). PayPal they just need to give me the email.
 
Hope this is helpful, let me know if you need anything else 
😊
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 16:01
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
HI again SG. I also found this old form (attached) that it seems we used to send to translators to get their banking info / payment preferences. Again, no rush, but can you also check if the attached is needed? Or maybe parts are needed or things need to be updated?
 
Thanks again!
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 12:15 PM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi SG.
 
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
 
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Asunto:
 Fw: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Hi. No rush, but I need your help with the onboarding of new translators.
 
Can you look at the attached "Translator-Interpreter Profile" doc & lmk if you would need to send this to new translators you hire? It looks like a way to capture their bank info (which SG could get off their invoice or other ways). And, it looks like it helps you track their rates. Let me know if you think you need to use this doc and/or make any changes to it.
 
I've also attached an email template I'm putting together that you could s
end to new translators to get what you need in terms of paperwork. I added a bunch of things in red I'm still working on. What else would you want to include in this doc? Do you need to share info about Trados here or anything else? Feel free to edit the doc.
 
I've also attached the updated Translator Agreement I am working on. Sending more of an FYI.
 
I know this is a lot. It's not a rush as I said. I'm just trying to help get you everything you need to send to new translators.
 
Happy to talk on thee phone about this another time too if easier.
 
Thanks!
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 6:01 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
So the way we currently pay vendors, in order of preference, is:
 
ACH to a US bank account
PayPal
(international wire, but the service we use is currently unavailable due to their vendor issues – I am looking into other options)
 
We don’t send physical checks anymore, it’s electronic only. For US bank accounts, I need the vendor to provide an email address, and then I will send them an invite to create a QuickBooks Money account to manage their information (or send me routing & account). PayPal they just need to give me the email.
 
Hope this is helpful, let me know if you need anything else 
😊
 
SG

Thanks again!

 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com

Subject:
 Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi SG.
 
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
 
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Asunto:
 Fw: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Hi. No rush, but I need your help with the onboarding of new translators.
 
Can you look at the attached "Translator-Interpreter Profile" doc & lmk if you would need to send this to new translators you hire? It looks like a way to capture their bank info (which SG could get off their invoice or other ways). And, it looks like it helps you track their rates. Let me know if you think you need to use this doc and/or make any changes to it.
 
I've also attached an email template I'm putting together that you could s
end to new translators to get what you need in terms of paperwork. I added a bunch of things in red I'm still working on. What else would you want to include in this doc? Do you need to share info about Trados here or anything else? Feel free to edit the doc.
 
I've also attached the updated Translator Agreement I am working on. Sending more of an FYI.
 
I know this is a lot. It's not a rush as I said. I'm just trying to help get you everything you need to send to new translators.
 
Happy to talk on thee phone about this another time too if easier.
 
Thanks!
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 6:01 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
So the way we currently pay vendors, in order of preference, is:
 
ACH to a US bank account
PayPal
(international wire, but the service we use is currently unavailable due to their vendor issues – I am looking into other options)
 
We don’t send physical checks anymore, it’s electronic only. For US bank accounts, I need the vendor to provide an email address, and then I will send them an invite to create a QuickBooks Money account to manage their information (or send me routing & account). PayPal they just need to give me the email.
 
Hope this is helpful, let me know if you need anything else 
😊
 
SG

 Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi SG.
 
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
 
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com

Subject:
 Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi SG.
 
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
 
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

subject: Re: Invoice from Nick Lingris
body:
Hello! I don’t see the pdf. What nick is asking for?
Is he a linguist? For compass/scoro most of the times we put 1 line to quote QA of all and if that project included translation, yes, that would be included in that line.
On one side, check all project files. There must be an excel or word where you see the quote details.
On the other side, check if adding as cost what Nick is asking is within budget/margin of what we charged the client.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.

Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. 
This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. 
Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? 
If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!
_________________________
Diligent

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

LCW

subject: REQUEST FOR A TRANSLATION
body:
Hello Brandy,
 
My name is Cecilia and I work at LCW. We received your voicemail about a request for a translation.
I tried to reach out to your number but unfortunately Im having some issues on my end.
Please let me know how can I assist you, would you like to share the file and languages requested so I can provide an estimate?
 
Cecilia

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

In the example below, you will see three "employees" who took the course. The two employees who passed show a score, whereas the employee who failed does not show a score in OData.
 
<image.png>
  
<image.png>
 
On the employee's end, this is what they will see.
 
<image.png>
 
Could this please be passed along to Dustin for review.
 
Thanks!
_________________________
Diligent
Randi Mooney,
 she/her
Advisory Specialist II, Advisory & Consulting Services
rmooney@diligent.com

diligent.com

EXTERNAL:
 This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
 
Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,

Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!
_________________________
Diligent

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.

Del Monte has completed an internal review of the provided SCORMs. During this review, they found some items that they would like to have updated across four languages: Italian, Chinese, French, and Japanese. I believe they must have missed these items during their translation review stage of the project. Please se
e the attached word doc for the consolidated edit requests.

Thanks!

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole
 
 
Nicole Barile

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

 Re: Fw: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
 
This will have a 3 hr charge from myself at $65/hr. Because they have a wrapper it needs to be tested and built in a bigger way than just published a SCORM for them.
 
I'll get this done by Monday for you to aid in helping Diligent, but similar to LCW for future projects we'll want to establish the timeline turnarounds that help LCW, have been standard with Diligent, as well on my end. Myself and my team don't always work through the weekend so it will be good to know how to space things out for predictability. It's best to assume I'm Mon-Fri but we can always talk case by case though! 
 
 
 
I hope you have a good weekend! And we'll talk next week.
 
Best,
Dustin

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

This will have a 3 hr charge from myself at $65/hr. Because they have a wrapper it needs to be tested and built in a bigger way than just published a SCORM for them.
I'll get this done by Monday for you to aid in helping Diligent, but similar to LCW for future projects we'll want to establish the timeline turnarounds that help LCW, have been standard with Diligent, as well on my end. Myself and my team don't always work through the weekend so it will be good to know how to space things out for predictability. It's best to assume I'm Mon-Fri but we can always talk case by case though! 
I hope you have a good weekend! And we'll talk next week.
Best,
Dustin

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hi Cecilia,
 
Happy Friday!
 
A few notes:
I will be 
out of the office
 this afternoon & Monday, but I will check emails. If you need something from me, please email me
 
I think we should keep our 
call with Diligent on Tues
, even if we don't have anything open. I want them to know we are committed to them & available to them.
 
Sure thing, I thought they only needed us if anything in progress
I think you should still send the
 Excel doc/summary
 to the Diligent team on Monday (or prior to the Tues call) and list anything that has been recently completed or is outstanding. For example, this GXO Quote is s
till awaiting a response from Diligent/GXO 
https://lcw.scoro.com/quotes/view/1565
. 
Is there any quote im not awaere of? Ill share it on Monday for sure!
Dustin lateness
 - regarding him being late with the last project... 
It would be great if we could be more proactive with Diligent. For example, if you see that Dustin is late, proactively reach out to him to find out what's going on & then report back to the client 
before 
they have the chance to follow up with us 
🙂
. 
I'd rather us reach out first to explain the delay than them coming to us.
 
You are right, keep this in mind
Dustin processes
 - up to you, but just a thought... 
Maybe it would be easier for Dustin to create the process docs first, and then you have a chat with him to discuss?? Again, this is totally up to you. I'm just thinking that maybe that would be better than you writing everything up. You could give him 1 process to do (like Diligent Code of Conduct), review it, re-work the formatting, make sure if has everything you need, talk to him about it... And then once the format is agreed upon & he understands what info he needs to give you, then he can do the other docs.
I'm not trying to micromanage here... It really is just a suggestion. But feel free to do it however you want. 
I may not be able to join the calls bc my schedule has been crazy
! I agree, I need to understand what he does because im still lost there ill reach out to him now and cc you there.
I did not forget about

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

subject: RE: Fw: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
body:
Hello Dustin,
 
We have received some edits from client, please find them attached.
Del Monte has completed an internal review of the provided SCORMs. During this review, they found some items that they would like to have updated across four languages: Italian, Chinese, French, and Japanese.
 
Can we have this back on Monday EOD? Please let me know also if any extra charges so we can communicate with client.
Thank you!
Cecilia

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!
_________________________
Diligent

subject: DILIGENT PROCESS
body:
Hi Dustin,
 
Its me again I hope you are getting ready to enjoy the weekend!
Im reaching out because since all our calendars are a little bit complicated, Id like to ask you if you could send us a step-by-step of the diligent process in written so I can take a look and reach out to you with specific questions about the process.
 
Is it possible to have it next week? I really want to understand how it works because im still lost here.
 
Thank you!
Cecilia 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

De:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Enviado el:
 viernes, 28 de marzo de 2025 11:39
Para:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Asunto:
 Diligent & misc. stuff
 
Hi Cecilia,
 
Happy Friday!
 
A few notes:
I will be 
out of the office
 this afternoon & Monday, but I will check emails. If you need something from me, please email me
 
I think we should keep our 
call with Diligent on Tues
, even if we don't have anything open. I want them to know we are committed to them & available to them.
 
Sure thing, I thought they only needed us if anything in progress
I think you should still send the
 Excel doc/summary
 to the Diligent team on Monday (or prior to the Tues call) and list anything that has been recently completed or is outstanding. For example, this GXO Quote is s
till awaiting a response from Diligent/GXO 
https://lcw.scoro.com/quotes/view/1565
. 
Is there any quote im not awaere of? Ill share it on Monday for sure!
Dustin lateness
 - regarding him being late with the last project... 
It would be great if we could be more proactive with Diligent. For example, if you see that Dustin is late, proactively reach out to him to find out what's going on & then report back to the client 
before 
they have the chance to follow up with us 
🙂
. 
I'd rather us reach out first to explain the delay than them coming to us.
 
You are right, keep this in mind
Dustin processes
 - up to you, but just a thought... 
Maybe it would be easier for Dustin to create the process docs first, and then you have a chat with him to discuss?? Again, this is totally up to you. I'm just thinking that maybe that would be better than you writing everything up. You could give him 1 process to do (like Diligent Code of Conduct), review it, re-work the formatting, make sure if has everything you need, talk to him about it... And then once the format is agreed upon & he understands what info he needs to give you, then he can do the other docs.
I'm not trying to micromanage here... It really is just a suggestion. But feel free to do it however you want. 
I may not be able to join the calls bc my schedule has been crazy
! I agree, I need to understand what he does because im still lost there ill reach out to him now and cc you there.
I did not forget about 
onboarding docs for translators
. 
Will look at that by next week. 
Will try to get to it this morning.
 
No rush on this!!
 
LMK if you have any questions/thoughts.
Thank you Cecilia!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler
