subject: Diligent & misc. stuff
body:
Hi Cecilia,
Happy Friday!
A few notes:
I will be 
out of the office
 this afternoon & Monday, but I will check emails. If you need something from me, please email me
I think we should keep our 
call with Diligent on Tues
, even if we don't have anything open. I want them to know we are committed to them & available to them.
I think you should still send the
 Excel doc/summary
 to the Diligent team on Monday (or prior to the Tues call) and list anything that has been recently completed or is outstanding. For example, this GXO Quote is still awaiting a response from Diligent/GXO 
https://lcw.scoro.com/quotes/view/1565
. 
Dustin lateness
 - regarding him being late with the last project... It would be great if we could be more proactive with Diligent. For example, if you see that Dustin is late, proactively reach out to him to find out what's going on & then report back to the client 
before 
they have the chance to follow up with us 🙂. I'd rather us reach out first to explain the delay than them coming to us.
Dustin processes
 - up to you, but just a thought... Maybe it would be easier for Dustin to create the process docs first, and then you have a chat with him to discuss?? Again, this is totally up to you. I'm just thinking that maybe that would be better than you writing everything up. You could give him 1 process to do (like Diligent Code of Conduct), review it, re-work the formatting, make sure if has everything you need, talk to him about it... And then once the format is agreed upon & he understands what info he needs to give you, then he can do the other docs.
I'm not trying to micromanage here... It really is just a suggestion. But feel free to do it however you want. I may not be able to join the calls bc my schedule has been crazy!
I did not forget about 
onboarding docs for translators
. Will look at that by next week. Will try to get to it this morning.
LMK if you have any questions/thoughts.
Thank you Cecilia!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Asunto:
 Organon COC Small Updates
 
Hello Cecilia and Nicole,
 
LCW assisted us with Organon's COC update last year. The customer came back to us recently and pointed out two typo's in their English course only. Would it be possible for your team to make these small changes and provide an ETA on when that can be completed?
 
Slide 28 - I see that the answer to question 3 on slide 28 is correct, however the explanation is incorrect – it relates the is issue on the prior slide. 
Slide 33 – small edit – change “violationsto” to “violations to”
 
 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
 
 
Thank you,
Karen

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 
(which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)

We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!

Reviewing translation of slides and video subtitles (EN version to be provided of course)

Hi Cecilia, 
Good morning and I hope you had a nice weekend. 
 
Thanks for your response. There must be a misunderstanding here because I was quoted $1300 per language to get the deck fully translated (no speaker notes, just the slides plus the video subtitling). Please see attached email thread with Catalina. 
 
So the client is definitely expecting the cost to be less than $1300 per language. If you’d like we can get on a call to clarify the project? I’d want to know why QAing work done by our client would cost more than doing a straight translation.  
 
Thanks!
Rebecca

Hello Rebecca,
 
Here is my estimate according to what you provided and all the files, I have divided it by files:
 
Understanding Your Cultural Lens_FINAL
Linguistic QA: 7 hs
Post DTP QA: 2 hs
LATAM_LeadingInclusively-Solo_2024_FINALv2
Linguistic QA: 12 hs
Post DTP QA: 3 hs
 
TOTAL QA TIME
: 24 hs / Language
TOTAL USD:
 
1800 USD per language
.
 
 
Linguistic QA: Implies editing translations
Post DTP QA: involves making sure layout after translation and DTP mirrors exactly as source.
Both tasks include the revision of everything translated and formatted by client, this includes subtitles of videos. Notes were not included in the estimate.
These costs also include the implementation of edits in PPT but NOT in videos. If subtitles need to be modified, those costs will be analyzed separately.
 
Please let me know if this is clear or if the estimate should be provided in any different way.
 
 
Cecilia Mariotta

Hello Rebecca,
 
For some reason I cannot access the PPT files provided below.
 
Just some things while you re share with me the files:
 
We will just QA and we will not translate anything or be in charge of creating subtitles. (I mention this because it can be confusing what they will do and what we will do)  
We will just QA and not translate anything. Let’s assume we’re not creating subtitles.
The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom. 
Yes.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)  
Yes
Can you confirm this is correct? And reshare the files with me?
 
The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.
 
Thank you!!

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 
(which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)

Asunto:
 RE: Translation invoice ready
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

Asunto:
 Organon COC Small Updates
 
Hello Cecilia and Nicole,
 
LCW assisted us with Organon's COC update last year. The customer came back to us recently and pointed out two typo's in their English course only. Would it be possible for your team to make these small changes and provide an ETA on when that can be completed?
 
Slide 28 - I see that the answer to question 3 on slide 28 is correct, however the explanation is incorrect – it relates the is issue on the prior slide. 
Slide 33 – small edit – change “violationsto” to “violations to”
 
 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
 
 
Thank you,
Karen

body:

I checked Catalina´s numbers and I think we can reduce the total amount if we do a regular QA and not an edition. Im not sure how she calculated those costs, but of course we need to be consistent with that.

:  6 hs / Language

.

Asunto:
 RE: Chuck or Nicole: giving Cecilia access to DB folders
 
Hi Cecilia, 
Good morning and I hope you had a nice weekend. 
 
Thanks for your response. There must be a misunderstanding here because I was quoted $1300 per language to get the deck fully translated (no speaker notes, just the slides plus the video subtitling). Please see attached email thread with Catalina. 
 
So the client is definitely expecting the cost to be less than $1300 per language. If you’d like we can get on a call to clarify the project? I’d want to know why QAing work done by our client would cost more than doing a straight translation.

The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom. 
Yes.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)  
Yes

The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 
(which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla

Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hello Dustin,
 
Nice to E-meet you! I hope you are doing great today!
Im contacting you because we need your assistance, can you please let me know your availability to have a call?
We need you to walk us through Diligence and the process involved, im not taking your job believe me, but Id like to have a better understanding of what is required, how, when, in what way etc.
We will also need you to prepare us a stepbystep for dummies of what is involved here, specially when quoting, what to expect, what to look at, where to find everything, etc. since we need to have a process documented for the company.
Please let us know when you can meet and we will send the invite.
 
 
Thank you for your time!
Cecilia

Asunto:
 RE: Translation invoice ready
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

body:
Hello Rebecca,
 
Please let me go through the emails Catalina sent and my estimate. Not sure how she got those numbers, but let me go again through that.
I understand that we should provide less than 1300, do they need just a QA – checking final product looks perfect and no linguist input? May be I quoted a deep revision and they just want to make sure layout and subtitles look correct.
Let me know while I review everything!
Cecilia

Asunto:
 RE: Chuck or Nicole: giving Cecilia access to DB folders
 
Hi Cecilia, 
Good morning and I hope you had a nice weekend. 
 
Thanks for your response. There must be a misunderstanding here because I was quoted $1300 per language to get the deck fully translated (no speaker notes, just the slides plus the video subtitling). Please see attached email thread with Catalina. 
 
So the client is definitely expecting the cost to be less than $1300 per language. If you’d like we can get on a call to clarify the project? I’d want to know why QAing work done by our client would cost more than doing a straight translation.  
 
Thanks!
Rebecca
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
 
From:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>

To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com

 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Chuck or Nicole: giving Cecilia access to DB folders
 
Hello Rebecca,
 
Here is my estimate according to what you provided and all the files, I have divided it by files:
 
Understanding Your Cultural Lens_FINAL
Linguistic QA: 7 hs
Post DTP QA: 2 hs
LATAM_LeadingInclusively-Solo_2024_FINALv2
Linguistic QA: 12 hs
Post DTP QA: 3 hs
 
TOTAL QA TIME
: 24 hs / Language
TOTAL USD:
 
1800 USD per language
.
 
 
Linguistic QA: Implies editing translations
Post DTP QA: involves making sure layout after translation and DTP mirrors exactly as source.
Both tasks include the revision of everything translated and formatted by client, this includes subtitles of videos. Notes were not included in the estimate.
These costs also include the implementation of edits in PPT but NOT in videos. If subtitles need to be modified, those costs will be analyzed separately.
 
Please let me know if this is clear or if the estimate should be provided in any different way.
 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Rebecca,
 
For some reason I cannot access the PPT files provided below.
 
Just some things while you re share with me the files:
 
We will just QA and we will not translate anything or be in charge of creating subtitles. (I mention this because it can be confusing what they will do and what we will do)  
We will just QA and not translate anything. Let’s assume we’re not creating subtitles.
The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom. 
Yes.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)  
Yes
Can you confirm this is correct? And reshare the files with me?
 
The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT

subject: RE: Chuck or Nicole: giving Cecilia access to DB folders
body:
Hi Cecilia, 
Good morning and I hope you had a nice weekend. 
 
Thanks for your response. There must be a misunderstanding here because I was quoted $1300 per language to get the deck fully translated (no speaker notes, just the slides plus the video subtitling). Please see attached email thread with Catalina. 
 
So the client is definitely expecting the cost to be less than $1300 per language. If you’d like we can get on a call to clarify the project? I’d want to know why QAing work done by our client would cost more than doing a straight translation.  
 
Thanks!
Rebecca
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
 
From:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>

To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Chuck or Nicole: giving Cecilia access to DB folders
 
Hello Rebecca,
 
Here is my estimate according to what you provided and all the files, I have divided it by files:
 
Understanding Your Cultural Lens_FINAL
Linguistic QA: 7 hs
Post DTP QA: 2 hs
LATAM_LeadingInclusively-Solo_2024_FINALv2
Linguistic QA: 12 hs
Post DTP QA: 3 hs
 
TOTAL QA TIME
: 24 hs / Language
TOTAL USD:
 
1800 USD per language
.
 
 
Linguistic QA: Implies editing translations
Post DTP QA: involves making sure layout after translation and DTP mirrors exactly as source.
Both tasks include the revision of everything translated and formatted by client, this includes subtitles of videos. Notes were not included in the estimate.
These costs also include the implementation of edits in PPT but NOT in videos. If subtitles need to be modified, those costs will be analyzed separately.
 
Please let me know if this is clear or if the estimate should be provided in any different way.
 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

Yes.

Yes

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!

subject: RE: Chuck or Nicole: giving Cecilia access to DB folders
body:
Hello Rebecca,
 
Here is my estimate according to what you provided and all the files, I have divided it by files:
 
Understanding Your Cultural Lens_FINAL
Linguistic QA: 7 hs
Post DTP QA: 2 hs
LATAM_LeadingInclusively-Solo_2024_FINALv2
Linguistic QA: 12 hs
Post DTP QA: 3 hs
 
TOTAL QA TIME
: 24 hs / Language
TOTAL USD:
 
1800 USD per language
.
 
 
Linguistic QA: Implies editing translations
Post DTP QA: involves making sure layout after translation and DTP mirrors exactly as source.
Both tasks include the revision of everything translated and formatted by client, this includes subtitles of videos. Notes were not included in the estimate.
These costs also include the implementation of edits in PPT but NOT in videos. If subtitles need to be modified, those costs will be analyzed separately.
 
Please let me know if this is clear or if the estimate should be provided in any different way.
 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

For some reason I cannot access the PPT files provided below.
 
Just some things while you re share with me the files:
 
We will just QA and we will not translate anything or be in charge of creating subtitles. (I mention this because it can be confusing what they will do and what we will do)  
We will just QA and not translate anything. Let’s assume we’re not creating subtitles.
The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom. 
Yes.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)  
Yes
Can you confirm this is correct? And reshare the files with me?
 
The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.
 
Thank you!!
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

n.barile@lcwmail.com

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter

Subject:
 RE: how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hello Rebecca,
 
For some reason I cannot access the PPT files provided below.
 
Just some things while you re share with me the files:
 
We will just QA and we will not translate anything or be in charge of creating subtitles. (I mention this because it can be confusing what they will do and what we will do)  
We will just QA and not translate anything. Let’s assume we’re not creating subtitles.
The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom. 
Yes.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)  
Yes
Can you confirm this is correct? And reshare the files with me?
 
The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.
 
Thank you!!
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com

 miércoles, 19 de marzo de 2025 17:38
Para:

CC:
 Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>; Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
We help develop the mindsets and systems needed to foster resilient, diverse, and equitable teams that will be successful in a cross-cultural world.

|

I live and work in Chapel Hill, NC – on the traditional homelands of the Occaneechi, Shakori, Eno, and Sissipahaw peoples.

Hello Rebecca,
 
For some reason I cannot access the PPT files provided below.
 
Just some things while you re share with me the files:
 
We will just QA and we will not translate anything or be in charge of creating subtitles. (I mention this because it can be confusing what they will do and what we will do)  
We will just QA and not translate anything. Let’s assume we’re not creating subtitles.
The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom. 
Yes.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)  
Yes
Can you confirm this is correct? And reshare the files with me?
 
The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.
 
Thank you!!

Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
·
         
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
·
         
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
·
         
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
·
         
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)

subject: Re: how much do we pay reviewers?
body:
Remind me to show you tomorrow.
We have a set QA rate of $75/hr for all GLS clients. Diligent has their higher rate.
LCW is treated as an external client. Let me think about how to explain that 🙂. Will do tmrw!

Subject:
 RE: how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hello Rebecca,
 
For some reason I cannot access the PPT files provided below.
 
Just some things while you re share with me the files:
 
We will just QA and we will not translate anything or be in charge of creating subtitles. (I mention this because it can be confusing what they will do and what we will do)
The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)
Can you confirm this is correct? And reshare the files with me?
 
The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.
 
Thank you!!
Cecilia

>; Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property.
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for:
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
:
·
        
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
·
        
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) – 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
·
        
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
·
        
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
.
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)

Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled 
out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

subject: Re: how much do we pay reviewers?
body:
Sorry to jump in...
Our reviewers might charge $35-40/hr, but that's not what we charge our clients. I assume we charge the QA rate of $75, no? That's the rate Rebecca would need to know. I got this rate from Scoro.
From:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 20, 2025 4:33 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: how much do we pay reviewers?
 
 
Hello Rebecca,
 
For some reason I cannot access the PPT files provided below.
 
Just some things while you re share with me the files:
 
We will just QA and we will not translate anything or be in charge of creating subtitles. (I mention this because it can be confusing what they will do and what we will do)
The QA will involve: PDFS and VIDEOS. All the pdfs and the videos as indicated below and the Quiz in Zoom.
Languages: Portuguese Brazil and Spanish (different scopes)
Can you confirm this is correct? And reshare the files with me?
 
The QA/Revision is paid per hour. I can estimate an approximate time once I have all the information. Please note that videos even when they say 8 minutes, revision takes longer as QAer or Reviewer needs to spot and add the mistakes/corrections in written so they can fix it.
 
Our reviewers charge: 25/30 USD per hour.
 
Thank you!!
Cecilia
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

 | 
Twitter
 | 
Facebook
 | 
LinkedIn
View our upcoming events
 | 
Sign-up for our newsletter
 
De:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Enviado el:
 miércoles, 19 de marzo de 2025 17:38
Para:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
CC:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Asunto:
 how much do we pay reviewers?
 
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property.
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for:
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
:
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) – 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
.
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
We help develop the mindsets and systems needed to foster resilient, diverse, and equitable teams that will be successful in a cross-cultural world.

|

I live and work in Chapel Hill, NC – on the traditional homelands of the Occaneechi, Shakori, Eno, and Sissipahaw peoples.

Asunto:
 RE: Translation invoice ready
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

body:
Hi. Do you know how to fill out the invoices for Diligent & other clients?
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 20, 2025 11:54 AM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Translation invoice ready
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>

subject: how much do we pay reviewers?
body:
Hi Cecilia, how are you?  I’m talking with Boston scientific, one of our biggest clients, about allowing them to use internal translators to translate two different PPT presentations into Spanish and Portuguese. I’m speaking with Chuck and Nicole about allowing that, as long as we are able to QA the translation and approve them, keeping the integrity of the content and our intellectual property. 
 
How much would we typically charge a client to QA the Spanish (LatAm) and Portuguese (Brazil) translations for: 
This PPT
 (video on slide 3 which has script in the speaker notes) and
This PPT
: 
Slide 19: Video: 
¿México e racista o colorista?” 
 (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fgOrV2uJUU
) 
– video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 22: Video: 
 “Indigenas Urbanos: Los desafios de los pueblos indigenas en ciudades
” (which came from 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bl9viILCREM
) 
– 
video is on Spanish, so only needed to translate into PTB
Slide 30: Video: “A Class Divided” (see attached for script). 
This video is located 
here
 (in our Dropbox) but we only need until 8:42 (“…it’s a horrid day”). Even when I download the video from the workshop deck (which is 8:42) it provides me with the longer 13:25 version!
There is also a Quiz on Zoom which would also need translation (see attached for English).
 
We’d be QAing 
the slides only (not the speaker notes
, they will not translate those) and the 
videos would need subtitles only
. 
 
And how much do we typically pay reviewers to do this?
 
Gracias!
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
We help develop the mindsets and systems needed to foster resilient, diverse, and equitable teams that will be successful in a cross-cultural world.

|

|

I live and work in Chapel Hill, NC – on the traditional homelands of the Occaneechi, Shakori, Eno, and Sissipahaw peoples.

subject: DILIGENT TRANSITION- INFORMATIVE CALL
body:
Hello Dustin,
 
Nice to E-meet you! I hope you are doing great today!
Im contacting you because we need your assistance, can you please let me know your availability to have a call?
We need you to walk us through Diligence and the process involved, im not taking your job believe me, but Id like to have a better understanding of what is required, how, when, in what way etc.
We will also need you to prepare us a stepbystep for dummies of what is involved here, specially when quoting, what to expect, what to look at, where to find everything, etc. since we need to have a process documented for the company.
Please let us know when you can meet and we will send the invite.
 
 
Thank you for your time!
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Cecilia and Nicole,
 
I hope this email finds you well! Wanted to submit a WO request for some URL updates on a CoC course!
 
I attached the workorder request above and uploaded it in the Jeld Wen folder in our fileshare (
https://securefiles.diligentboards.com/web/room/drid:5a13e4a6-dd40-43d9-8dff-a0e9c0805fe3/content
):
 
 
 
To summarize the request: There is a slide in the course across all languages (I believe it was slide 5) that has a URL pointing them to a document/site. The URLs have changed across all languages, and they would like the updated URLs placed and have SCORM files re-generated.
 
May I request the associated cost and timing of this request please? I’m crossing my fingers it won’t be too onerous, but do let me know the expected cost, with a rush order applied if possible.
 
Thanks in advance,
 
Don

I hope this email finds you well! Wanted to submit a WO request for some URL updates on a CoC course!

https://securefiles.diligentboards.com/web/room/drid:5a13e4a6-dd40-43d9-8dff-a0e9c0805fe3/content
):
 
 
 
To summarize the request: There is a slide in the course across all languages (I believe it was slide 5) that has a URL pointing them to a document/site. The URLs have changed across all languages, and they would like the updated URLs placed and have SCORM files re-generated.

Don

I'm jumping in here. I believe this was a system error. This was a quote for Portuguese that never happened. You can disregard the invoice. Please let us know if you need anything else.
Apologies for the confusion.
Have a great weekend!
Nicole
From:
 Karen Lai <klai@diligent.com>
Sent:
 Friday, April 4, 2025 1:59 PM
To:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>; Global Language Solutions <gls@lcwmail.com>; invoices Americas <Invoices+AMERICAS@diligent.coupahost.com>
Cc:
 Brian Luong <bluong@diligent.com>; Don Reyes <dreyes@diligent.com>; Kumud Mishra <kmishra@diligent.com>; Randi Mooney <rmooney@diligent.com>
Subject:
 Re: LCW invoice #25049
 
 
Hi Cecilia,
Your accounting team provided our team with this invoice for Altera, for $1645 USD on Tuesday. We reached out to Nicole inquiring about what this charge was for, as mentioned we have no records of this estimate.
Thanks,
Karen

 Re: LCW invoice #25049
 
Hi Cecilia,
 
We reviewed our records and were never provided with the Estimate you attached (2024384), which would also indicate that we did not approve this. 
 
The only estimate that was provided and approved for Altera is attached for $3445, which has been invoiced already.
 
Let us know if you have any questions.
 
 
Thanks,
Karen
